image.altText: A graphic image showing the NDIS logo, a hand on a calculator, and stacks of folders.

props.synopsis: Disability was a big part of this year's federal budget. Here are the key takeaways now the dust has settled.

title.children: From NDIS cost revisions to a new employment program, what's in 2024 budget for disability?

image.altText: Budget 2024-25 papers with the deficit line overlaid and some additional graphic treatment.

props.synopsis: The federal budget is in its second year of surplus, but is poised to fall back into deficit for the next decade. Why? And should we be worried?

title.children: You can't have a surplus and your tax cuts too — why Australia's budget will be in the red for a decade

image.altText: A pit head is seen at the Tumela platinum mine in front of a sunset.

props.synopsis: Anglo American owns five mines in Queensland's Bowen Basin — Moranbah North, Capcoal, Dawson, Aquila and Grosvenor.

title.children: Anglo American's move to sell Queensland coal mines 'unnerves' communities that rely on them

image.altText: Mental Health Public Entry sign.

props.synopsis: Three people have taken their own lives inside a locked mental health unit at The Prince Charles Hospital in the past 16 months, prompting a major review.

title.children: Three patients die by suicide inside a secure Brisbane public mental health unit

image.altText: A middle-aged blonde woman in glasses and a yellow jacket asks a question in a large green room.

props.synopsis: The 2024 federal budget has been handed down, and the government has begun the process of selling it to the public. Follow live.

title.children: 'All I've heard is outrage': Independent MP calls out level of domestic violence funding in budget

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Will people with multiple properties be able to get multiple energy relief payments?
'Providing energy bill relief at a time when households are under pressure'
Rates cut could come in 2025, says economist

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: The daughter of Carol Clay tells a Victorian court her mother had a "very loving and caring" relationship with Russell Hill, with whom she was allegedly murdered during a camping trip in 2020.

title.children: Victorian campers had 'loving, caring' relationship, murder trial hears

image.altText: Black snake in ute.

props.synopsis: Newcastle woman Lisa Kournelis has been driving around with a deadly snake in her car for about six weeks. It's not unheard of for snakes to make their way into vehicles, but it is highly unusual for them to linger so long. So why is this one still there?

title.children: Why won't 'Fluffy' the red-bellied black snake leave Lisa's car?

image.altText: A distraught middle-aged man and woman stand in front of a grey curtain

props.synopsis: It's been almost two weeks since Kye Schaefer was fatally stabbed in Coffs Harbour. His parents are calling on the person responsible to be "honest and own up".

title.children: Parents of 21-year-old stabbed to death while heading for a surf issue tearful plea to killer

image.altText: A woman with red short hair in a light blue shirt is in a wheelchair and laughing while in front of a beach outside

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Elly Desmarchelier shares the financial reality of living with a disability, why salary-sacrificing her car turned out to be a disaster, and the money advice from her parents that she carries with her to this day.

title.children: Pay Day with Elly Desmarchelier: 'Paying my disability tax is no mean feat'

image.altText: A protest in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: Hundreds of marching students call on their universities to cut ties with companies linked to Israel, as administrators urge protesters to pack up their campsites.

title.children: Melbourne students march through CBD as universities urge Pro-Palestinian protesters to disperse encampments

image.altText: A large army truck crashed into a petrol station

props.synopsis: A large army truck has caused serious damage after driving into the roof of a Bruce Highway petrol station on the way to a military exercise.

title.children: Army truck ploughs into service station in North Queensland

image.altText: Jim Chalmers stands at the podium of the national press club

props.synopsis: With an eye to the next election, Treasurer Jim Chalmers spruiked what he saw as the government's economic achievements in last night's budget speech. But did he stick to the facts?

title.children: We fact checked some key claims from Jim Chalmers's budget speech. Here's what we found

image.altText: Police standing in a line.

props.synopsis: Three people have been killed as violent protests and looting rock New Caledonia, according to an official of the French Pacific territory.

title.children: Three killed in New Caledonia unrest as France deploys back-up police

image.altText: A person's arms are pictured shaping a heart with its hands, behind it a large round portal in which people in Dublin are seen

props.synopsis: Officials have hit a pause on a video screen called The Portal that lets people in New York and Dublin peer into life on opposite sides of the Atlantic in real time.

title.children: Sidewalk video portal connecting New York and Dublin paused after spectators caught misbehaving on camera

image.altText: A SA Police officer's shoulder badge.

props.synopsis: A 63-year-old woman from Adelaide's west will face court in August after being arrested over what police have described as "historical sexual offences against children".

title.children: Police arrest 63yo Adelaide woman over alleged historical child sex offences

image.altText: A composite image of a woman in a black hoodie, a loveheart-shaped pin of two boys, and a third boy in school uniform

props.synopsis: Wendy Elizabeth Chattaway was previously jailed for 12 months for lying to police about her role in a horror crash that claimed the lives of a mother and three children at Yanco near Leeton during 2023.

title.children: Driver involved in crash that killed woman and three children avoids time behind bars

image.altText: Shane walks along carrying documents and wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian Federal Police officers file a case against the ACT government and former ACT top prosecutor Shane Drumgold over comments he made after the trial of Mr Lehrmann collapsed.

title.children: Former ACT prosecutor sued for defamation by AFP officers over allegations of interference in Bruce Lehrmann case

image.altText: a man in a blue shirt and white broad-brimmed hat leaning on a cattle yard rail.

props.synopsis: Australian Agricultural Company says its financial position is strong despite a difficult year, with its herd across Queensland and the Northern Territory increasing to about 455,000 head.

title.children: Australia's largest cattle company's herd grows but its value drops nearly $150 million

image.altText: Kevin Gallagher wears a suit at a press conference in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Gas giant Santos sacks about 200 staff members, most of them based in Perth, citing slower project approval times.

title.children: 'Surplus to our business activity': Gas giant Santos lays off about 200 Perth workers

image.altText: Shiny silver coins on display inside the Mint with an effigy of King Charles III on the back.

props.synopsis: The first full proof set of Australian coins bearing the face of King Charles III was unveiled at the Royal Australian Mint in Canberra today, and they've been described as "a beautiful memento of an important change in the framework of Australia".

title.children: For the first time in 59 years, a king will appear on all of Australia's newly minted coins

image.altText: An older white man in a suit looks serious as he walks through a town square surrounded by security.

props.synopsis: The US secretary of state met with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, talked up Ukraine's prospects as a NATO candidate and even played guitar during the surprise visit.

title.children: Blinken vows unwavering support for Ukraine during Kyiv visit as Russian attacks intensify

image.altText: Hands holding a power bill

props.synopsis: Last night's budget had a few measures that could put extra money in your pocket. But don't expect a cheque in the mail or a bonus payment directly into your bank account.

title.children: How you'll get the $300 energy rebate promised in last night's budget

image.altText: Coremiocnemis tropix in the laboratory

props.synopsis: A University of the Sunshine Coast researcher working with the world's "largest arachnid venom collection" is aiming to invent a honey-bee-friendly bio-insecticide for farmers battling swarms of hungry locusts.

title.children: Spider venom to be tested in the fight against plague locusts

image.altText: An older man with dark hair and a moustache sits in an electric wheelchair.

props.synopsis: The Perth Public Transport Authority has confirmed that correct procedures were not followed when the 71-year-old sustained serious injuries while disembarking.

title.children: 'Not our finest hour': Transperth admits fault as 71-year-old man in wheelchair injured getting off bus

image.altText: a drone photo taken above streets with dark roofed houses

props.synopsis: The Albanese government dedicated a special chapter in its budget to Australia's housing crisis, and it used these graphs to illustrate the problem.

title.children: Australia's housing crisis in 10 graphs, from the federal budget

image.altText: A man sits on the bed of an MRI machine looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Richard Scolyer, who has treated his stage four brain cancer using his own research, has announced his latest scans show no new cancer growth one year after his initial diagnosis.

title.children: Australian of the Year brain cancer free one year on from diagnosis

image.altText: A photo graphic of a blurred-out young male on a mobile phone sitting in front of a laptop.

props.synopsis: For up to four weeks, Alex and his family received up to 50 food deliveries a day after his address was shared by someone he had an argument with while playing Call of Duty online. Here's what to do if, like Alex, you've been doxxed.

title.children: Alex was doxxed while playing Call of Duty. What happened next was a living nightmare for him and his family

image.altText: Meryl Streep in a white dress and sunglasses, arms outstretched, head thrown back, beneath the Cannes symbol

props.synopsis: Here's your run-down of the most-hyped films, Australian offerings and potential controversies at the 77th annual Festival de Cannes.

title.children: Cannes 2024: The biggest films, potential controversies and much more

image.altText: Sage the Black poodle struts around the ring

props.synopsis: Sage emerged victorious from more than 2,500 top-ranked canines competing in a two-day contest.

title.children: Sage the miniature poodle fetches top prize at prestigious US dog show

image.altText: Cara Koenen holds her face

props.synopsis: What are the quick fixes Super Netball can make to avoid another scoreboard debacle like the one in round five? Meanwhile, a three-time World Champion receives a surprise call-up at 40 years old and lopsided scorelines raise concerns about the league's expansion.

title.children: Super Netball Round-Up: Scoreboard shocker, the return of a legend falls flat and match blowouts raise concerns about expansion

image.altText: A woman with curly hair, carrying her dog, standing outside a colourfully-decorated red yurt.

props.synopsis: When renting became unaffordable, single mum Beck Meyers started camping on a bush block she bought with a friend. Now, she, her children, and her friend are at risk of being evicted into homelessness by their local council.

title.children: 'Bureaucracy gone mad': Family told to leave their own land

image.altText: Twin sisters standing back to back smiling at the camera in very colourful tops

props.synopsis: Georgia Laurie repeatedly hit the reptile in the nose to save her sister while swimming in a river in Mexico in 2021.

title.children: Twin who punched crocodile to save her sister receives King's medal for bravery

image.altText: A historical statue cut down and vandalised.

props.synopsis: A colonial-era statue honouring a former premier who mutilated the body of an Aboriginal man is vandalised on the eve of a tribunal decision on its planned removal.

title.children: 'What goes around': Former premier's statue chopped down in the night, a day after vandals' first attempt
